comment.author: 54017078@N00
comment._content: Theft of four rabbits... So quaint!

comment.author: 24703779@N08
comment._content:
None of the male convicts I've seen in this set are over 5ft 10". Or the females for that matter. 

Possibly meaningless but slightly odd all the same...

comment.author: 29295370@N07
63685243@N08
comment._content: i noticed this but assumed this was because it was 140 years ago! my mum is 54 about 5'6 and said she used to be tall for her age, i'm her daughter at 6ft and although i am most definitely tall for this generation, i know quite a few girls who are as tall as me!

comment.author: 69220340@N06
comment._content: It's not that odd at all, that they were so short. Poor nutrition, kids being sent to workhouses at young ages, and lack of vitamins left nothing for the body to really grow on.

comment.author: 9504406@N03
comment._content: Wasn't Ricketts pretty prevelant in the 1800's?  That would stunt growth.

comment.author: 82065669@N08
comment._content: Evolution.  People are getting taller.  If you go visit an old fort (like in St. Augustine, FL), they'll tell you that the bunks where the men slept are so small because people were much shorter back then.  Poor nutrition is also certainly a factor.  Also, the growth hormones in the food we eat may be making us larger?  I'm a 5'11" female.
